   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   50:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   51:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   52:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   53:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   54:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     zip_groups().
   58: 
   59: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   60: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   61: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   62: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   63: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   64: 
   65: zip_groups() ->
   66: 
   67:     ZipGroup=
   68:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   69:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   70:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   71:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   72: 
   73:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   74:         [{z64(ZipMode), [], [zip64_central_headers]++
   75:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   80: 
   81: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   82:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   83: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   84:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   85: 
   86: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   87:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   88:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   89:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   90:         [_Mode] ->
   91:             Z64Mode
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: zip_testcases() ->
   95:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   96: 
   97: zip64_testcases() ->
   98:     [unzip64_central_headers,
   99:      zip64_central_directory].
  100: 
  101: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  103:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  104:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  105: 
  106: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  107:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  108:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  109:     ok.
  110: 
  111: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  112:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  113:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  114:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  115:         _ -> ok
  116:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(get_value(priv_dir,Config), "*"))].
  117: 
  118: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  119:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  120: 
  121:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize), disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  122:         {4, _, _} ->
  123:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  124:         {8, error, _} ->
  125:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  126:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  127:         {8, N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= 8 * (1 bsl 30) ->
  128:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  129:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  130:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  131:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  132:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  133:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  134:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  135: 
  136:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  137:         {8,N,M} ->
  138:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  139:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  140:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  141:     end;
  142: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  143:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  144:         true ->
  145:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  146:                 undefined ->
  147:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  148:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  149:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  150:                 _Zip ->
  151:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  152:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  153:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  154:             end;
  155:         false ->
  156:             Config
  157:     end.
  158: 
  159: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  160:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  161:     Config.
  162: 
  163: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  164:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  165:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  166:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  167:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  168:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  169:        true ->
  170:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  171:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  172:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: 
  176: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  177:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  178:     Config.
  179: 
  180: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  181: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  182: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  183: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  184:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  185:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  186: 
  187:     Record = 512,
  188:     Block = 20 * Record,
  189: 
  190:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  191:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  192:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  193:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  194:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  195: 
  196:     %% Clean up.
  197:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  201:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  202:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  203:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  204: 
  205:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  206:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  207:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  208:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  209:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  210: 
  211:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  212:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  213:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  214:                     info = Info,
  215:                     offset = 0,
  216:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  217:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  218:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  219: 
  220:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  221:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  222:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  223: 
  224: 
  225:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  226:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  227: 
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  231:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  232:         true ->
  233:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  234:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  235:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  236:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  237:         _ ->
  238:             ok
  239:     end.
  240: 
  241: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  242:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  243: 
  244: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  245:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  246:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  247: 
  248: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  249:     receive
  250:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  251:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  252:         {Port, eof} ->
  253:             Port ! {self(), close},
  254:             receive
  255:                 {Port, closed} ->
  256:                     true
  257:             end,
  258:             receive
  259:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  260:                     ok
  261:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  262:                     ok
  263:             end,
  264:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  268:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  269: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  270:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  271: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  272:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  273: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  274:     ok.
  275: 
  276: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  277:     unlink(Port),
  278:     exit(Port, die),
  279:     ct:fail(Reason).
  280: 
  281: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  282:     Cmd.
  283: %%     case os:type() of
  284: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  285: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  286: %%     end.
  287: 
  288: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  289: 
  290: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  291:     X = next_random(X0),
  292:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  293:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  294:         _ -> false
  295:     end;
  296: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  297:     true.
  298: 
  299: %% Generates a random byte list.
  300: 
  301: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  302:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  303: 
  304: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  305:     X = next_random(X0),
  306:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  307: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  308:     lists:reverse(Result).
  309: 
  310: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  311: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  312: 
  313: next_random(X) ->
  314:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  315: 
  316: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  317: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  318: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  320:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  321:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  322:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  323: 
  324:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  325: 
  326:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  327:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  328:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  329: 
  330:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  331: 
  332:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  333:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  334:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  335:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  336: 
  337:     %% Clean up.
  338:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  339: 
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  343: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  344: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  345:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  346:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  347:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  348:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  349: 
  350:     %% Create a zip archive
  351:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  352:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  353: 
  354:     %% Open archive
  355:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  356: 
  357:     %% List dir
  358:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  359: 
  360:     %% Get a file
  361:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  362:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  363:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  364:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  365:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  366: 
  367:     %% Get all files
  368:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  369:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  370:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  371: 
  372:     %% Close
  373:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  374: 
  375:     %% Clean up.
  376:     delete_files([Names]),
  377: 
  378:     ok.
  379: 
  380: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  381: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  382: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  383: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  384:     %% Create a zip archive
  385:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  386:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  387: 
  388:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  389:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  390: 
  391:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  392:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  393: 
  394:     %% Clean up.
  395:     delete_files([Zip]),
  396: 
  397:     ok.
  398: 
  399: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  400:     Self = self(),
  401:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  402:     receive
  403:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  404:             ZipSrv
  405:     end.
  406: 
  407: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  408:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  409:     receive
  410:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  411:             true
  412:     after 1000 ->
  413:             false
  414:     end.
  415: 
  416: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  417: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  419:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  420:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  421: 
  422:     %% create a temp directory
  423:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  424:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  425: 
  426:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  427: 
  428:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  429:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  430: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  431: 
  432:     %% Verify.
  433:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  434:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  435: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  436: 		  FList),
  437:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  438: 		  RetList),
  439: 
  440:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  441:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  442: 
  443:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  444: 
  445:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  446:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  447: 
  448:     %% Verify.
  449:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  450:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  451: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  452: 		  FList2),
  453:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  454: 		  RetList2),
  455: 
  456:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  457:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  458:     ok.
  459: 
  460: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  461: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  462:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  463:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  464:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  465: 
  466:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  467:     %% clash.txt
  468:     %% ../clash.txt
  469:     %% ../above.txt
  470:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  471: 
  472:     %% create a temp directory
  473:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  474:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  475:     
  476:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  477:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  478:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  479: 
  480:     %% unzip in SubDir
  481:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  482: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  483: 
  484:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  485: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  486:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  487:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  488: 
  489:     %% clean up
  490:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  491:     
  492:      %% create the temp directory again
  493:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  494: 
  495:     %% unzip in SubDir
  496:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  497: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  498: 
  499:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  500: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  501:    
  502:     %% clean up
  503:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  507: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  508:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  509:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  510:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  511: 
  512:     %% create a temp directory
  513:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  514:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  515: 
  516:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  517: 
  518:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  519: 
  520:     %% Verify.
  521:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  522: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  523: 		  FList),
  524:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  525:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  526:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  527:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  528:                           end
  529:                   end,
  530: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  531: 
  532:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  533:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  534:     ok.
  535: 
  536: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  537: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  539:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  540:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  541:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  542: 
  543:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  544:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  545: 
  546:     %% Create a zip archive
  547:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  548:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  549: 
  550:     %% Open archive
  551:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  552: 
  553:     %% List dir
  554:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  555: 
  556:     %% Get a file
  557:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  558:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  559:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  560: 
  561:     %% Get all files
  562:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  563:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  564:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  565: 
  566:     %% Close
  567:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  568: 
  569:     %% Clean up.
  570:     delete_files([Names]),
  571: 
  572:     ok.
  573: 
  574: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  575: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  576: 
  577:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  578:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  579: 
  580:     {ok,
  581:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  582:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  583: 
  584:     {ok,
  585:      [#zip_comment{},
  586:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  587:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  588:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  589:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  590:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  591: 
  592:     ok.
  593: 
  594: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  595: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  596:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  597: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  598:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  599:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  600: 
  601: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  602: char_seq(N, First) ->
  603:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  604: 
  605: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  606:     Result;
  607: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  608:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  609: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  610:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  611: 
  612: data_files() ->
  613:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  614:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  615:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  616:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  617:     create_files(Files),
  618:     Files.
  619: 
  620: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  621:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  622:     create_files(Rest);
  623: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  624:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  625:     create_files(Rest);
  626: create_files([]) ->
  627:     ok.
  628:

  633: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  634: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  635: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  636: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  637: %%     Dir.

  639: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  640: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  641:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  642:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  643:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  644:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  645:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  646:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  647:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  648:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  649:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  650:                   end,
  651:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  652:     ok.
  653: 
  654: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  655:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  656:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  657: 
  658: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  659:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  660: 
  661:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  662:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  663:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  664:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  665:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  666:     case What(Full) of
  667:         Expected ->
  668:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  669:         Other ->
  670:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  671:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  672:     end.
  673: 
  674: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  675: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  676:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  677:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  678:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  679:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  680:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  681: 
  682:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  683:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  684: 
  685:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  686:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  687: 
  688:     %% Verify.
  689:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  690:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  691:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  692:                               true ->
  693:                                   <<>> = B,
  694:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  695:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  696:                               false ->
  697:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  698:                           end
  699:                   end, FBList),
  700: 
  701:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  702:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  703: 
  704:     ok.
  705: 
  706: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  707: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  708:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),

  759: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  760: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  761:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  762:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  763:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  764:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  765: 
  766:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  767:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  768:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  769:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  770:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  771:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  772:     EmptyDir = "empty/",
  773:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  774: 
  775:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  776:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  777:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,EmptyDir,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  778: 
  779:     %% Verify.
  780:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  781:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  782:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  783: 
  784:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  785:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  786:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  787: 
  788:     %% Don't be in ExtractDir when we delete it
  789:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  790: 
  791:     %% Clean up.
  792:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  793: 
  794:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  795:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  796: 
  797:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary with skip_directories
  798:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  799:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  800: 
  801:     %% Verify.
  802:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  803:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  804:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  805: 
  806:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  807:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  808:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  809: 
  810:     %% Clean up.
  811:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  812: 
  813:     ok.

  815: %% oac_files() ->
  816: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  817: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  818: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  819: %%     create_files(Files),
  820: %%     Files.
  821: 
  822: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  823: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  824: delete_files(List) ->
  825:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  826: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  827:     Cnt;
  828: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  829:     case file:delete(Item) of
  830:         ok ->
  831:             DelCnt = 1;
  832:         {error,eperm} ->
  833:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  834:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  835:             file:del_dir(Item);
  836:         {error,eacces} ->
  837:             %% We'll see about that!
  838:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  839:             case file:delete(Item) of
  840:                 ok ->
  841: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  842:                 {error,_} ->
  843:                     erlang:yield(),
  844:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  845:                     file:delete(Item),
  846:                     DelCnt = 1
  847:             end;
  848:         {error,_} ->
  849:             DelCnt = 0
  850:     end,
  851:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  852: 
  853: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  854: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  855:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  856:     Dir = "compress_control",
  857:     Files = [
  858:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  859:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  860:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  861:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  862:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  863:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  864:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  865:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  866:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  867:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  868:             ],
  869: 
  870:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  871: 			  Files,
  872: 			  [{compress, []}],
  873: 			  []),
  874: 
  875:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  876: 			  Files,
  877: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  878: 			  []),
  879: 
  880:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  881: 			  Files,
  882: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  883: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  884: 
  885:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  886: 			  Files,
  887: 			  [],
  888: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  889: 
  890:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  891: 			  Files,
  892: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  893: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  894: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  895: 
  896:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  897: 			  Files,
  898: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  899: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  900: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  901: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  902: 
  903:     ok.
  904: 
  905: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  906:     %% Cleanup
  907:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  908:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  909:     delete_files([Zip]),
  910:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  911: 
  912:     create_files(Files),
  913:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  914: 
  915:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  916:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  917:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  918:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  919:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  920: 
  921:     %% Cleanup
  922:     delete_files([Zip]),
  923:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  924: 
  925:     ok.
  926: 
  927: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  928:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  929:         case Kind of
  930:             dir ->
  931:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  932:             _   ->
  933:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  934:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  935:         end,
  936:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  937:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  938: 
  939:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  940:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  941:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  942:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  943:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  944:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  945:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  946:     end,
  947:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  948: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  949:     ok.
  950: 
  951: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  952:     false;
  953: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  954:     CompressOpt =
  955:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  956:             [] -> all;
  957:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  958:         end,
  959:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  960:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  961:     UncompressOpt =
  962:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  963:             [] -> Default;
  964:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  965:         end,
  966:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  967:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  968: 
  969: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  970:     case H of
  971:         all ->
  972:             extensions(T, H);
  973:         H when is_list(H) ->
  974:             extensions(T, H);
  975:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  976:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  977:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  978:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  979:         _ ->
  980:             extensions(T, Old)
  981:     end;
  982: extensions([], Old) ->
  983:     Old.
  984: 
  985: foldl(Config) ->
  986:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  987:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  988: 
  989:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  990:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  991:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  992:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  993:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  994:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  995:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  996:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  997:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  998: 	try
  999: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1000: 	catch
 1001: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1002: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1003: 	end,
 1004:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1005:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1006: 
 1007:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1008:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1009:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1010: 
 1011:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1012:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1013: 
 1014:     ok.
 1015: 
 1016: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1017:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1018:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1019:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1020:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1021:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1022:                          ok
 1023:                  end,
 1024:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1025: 
 1026:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1027:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1028:                                                  ["none"]),
 1029:                         ok
 1030:                 end,
 1031:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1032: 
 1033:     ok.
 1034: 
 1035: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1036:     ok;
 1037: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1038:     try Bad() of
 1039:         ok ->
 1040:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1041:     catch
 1042:         C:R:Stk ->
 1043:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1044:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1045:     end.
 1046: 
 1047: unicode(Config) ->
 1048:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1049:         latin1 ->
 1050:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1051:         utf8 ->
 1052:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1053:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1054:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1055:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1056:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1057:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1058:             case has_zip() of
 1059:                 false ->
 1060:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1061:                 true ->
 1062:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1063:                         true ->
 1064:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1065:                             ok;
 1066:                         false ->
 1067:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1068:                     end
 1069:             end
 1070:     end.
 1071: 
 1072: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1073:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1074:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1075: 
 1076:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1077:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1078: 
 1079: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1080:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1081:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1082:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1083:     [begin
 1084:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1085:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1086:      end ||
 1087:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1088:     ok.
 1089: 
 1090: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1091:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1092:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1093:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1094:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1095:     {ok, Archive} =
 1096:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1097:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1098: 
 1099: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1100:     case test_zip1() of
 1101:         false ->
 1102:             ok;
 1103:         true ->
 1104:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1105:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1106:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1107:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1108:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1109:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1110:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1111:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1112:     end.
 1113: 
 1114: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1115:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1116:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1117:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1118:     ok.
 1119: 
 1120: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1121:     case test_zip1() of
 1122:         false ->
 1123:             ok;
 1124:         true ->
 1125:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1126:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1127:             Comment = [Char],
 1128:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1129:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1130: 
 1131:             {ok, _} =
 1132:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1133:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1134:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1135:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1136: 
 1137:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1138:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1139:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: test_zip1() ->
 1143:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1144: 
 1145: has_zip() ->
 1146:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1147: 
 1148: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1149:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1150:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1151: 
 1152: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1153:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1154:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1155:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1156:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1157:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1158:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1159:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1160:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1161:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1162:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1163:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1164:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1165:     ok.
 1166: 
 1167: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1168:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1169:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1170:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1171:     Comment = [9999999],
 1172:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1173:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1174: 
 1175: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1176:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1177:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1178:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1179:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1180: 
 1181: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1182:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1183:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1184:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1185:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1186:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1187:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1188:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1189:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1190:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1191:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1192:             ok;
 1193:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1194:     end.
 1195: 
 1196: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1197:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1198:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1199:              receive
 1200:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1201:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1202:                               Reciver()
 1203:              end
 1204:      end)().
 1205:     
 1206: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1207:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1208:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1209:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1210:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1211:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1212:     ok.
 1213: 
 1214: mode(Config) ->
 1215: 
 1216:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1217:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1218:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1219: 
 1220:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1221:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1222:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1223:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1224:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1225: 
 1226:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1227:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1228:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1229:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1230:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1231: 
 1232:     ?assertMatch(
 1233:        {ok, Archive},
 1234:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1235: 
 1236:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1237:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1238: 
 1239:     ?assertMatch(
 1240:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1241:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1242:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1243:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1244: 
 1245:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1246:     ?assertMatch(
 1247:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1248: 
 1249:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1250:         true ->
 1251:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1252:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1253:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1254: 
 1255:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1256:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1257:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777);
 1258:         false ->
 1259:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1260:             ok
 1261:     end,
 1262: 
 1263:     ok.
 1264: 
 1265: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1266: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1267: %%  * compressed size
 1268: %%  * uncompressed size
 1269: %%  * relative offset
 1270: %%  * starting disk
 1271: %%
 1272: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1273: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1274: 
 1275:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1276:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1277: 
 1278:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1279:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1280:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1281: 
 1282:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1283:     %% different header combinations.
 1284:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1285:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1286:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1287:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1288:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1289:     %%
 1290:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1291: 
 1292:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1293:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1294:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1295:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1296:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1297:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1298:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1299:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1300:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1301:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1302:     ?assertMatch(
 1303:        {ok, Archive},
 1304:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1305:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1306:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1307:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1308: 
 1309:     %% Check that list archive works
 1310:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1311:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1312:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1313:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1314:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1315:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1316:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1317:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1318:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1319:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1320:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1321:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1322:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1323:          ]} =
 1324:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1325:     ok.
 1326: 
 1327: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1328: 
 1329:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1330:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1331:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1332:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1333:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1334: 
 1335:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1336:     lists:map(
 1337:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1338:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1339:               ?assertMatch(
 1340:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1341:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1342:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1343:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1344:           F(Name) ->
 1345:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1346:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1347:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1348: 
 1349:     ok.
 1350: 
 1351: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1352: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1353: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1354: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1355: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1356: %%
 1357: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1358: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1359: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1360: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1361: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1362: 
 1363:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1364:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1365:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1366: 
 1367:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1368: 
 1369:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1370:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1371:     lists:foreach(
 1372:       fun(I) ->
 1373:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1374:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1375:     ?assertMatch(
 1376:        {ok, Archive},
 1377:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1378: 
 1379:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1380:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1381: 
 1382:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1383:     ?assertMatch(
 1384:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1385:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1386:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1387:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1388:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1389: 
 1390:     ok.
 1391: 
 1392: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1393: %% mtime of the file
 1394: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1395:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1396:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1397:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1398:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1399: 
 1400:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1401:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1402:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1403: 
 1404:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1405:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1406: 
 1407:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1408:     ?assertMatch(
 1409:        {ok, Archive},
 1410:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1411: 
 1412:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1413:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1414:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1415: 
 1416:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1417:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1418:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1419: 
 1420:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1421:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1422:     %% are in precise.
 1423:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1424:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1425: 
 1426:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1427:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1428: 
 1429:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1430:     ?assertMatch(
 1431:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1432:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1433: 
 1434:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1435:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1436:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1437:                              }} =
 1438:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1439: 
 1440: 
 1441:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1442: 
 1443:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1444:         true ->
 1445:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1446:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1447: 
 1448:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1449:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1450:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1451:         false ->
 1452:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1453:             ok
 1454:     end,
 1455: 
 1456:     ok.
 1457: 
 1458: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1459: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1460: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1461: 
 1462:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1463:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1464:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1465:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1466: 
 1467:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1468:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1469:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1470: 
 1471:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1472:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1473: 
 1474:     ?assertMatch(
 1475:        {ok, Archive},
 1476:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1477: 
 1478:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1479:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1480:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1481:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1482:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1483: 
 1484:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1485:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1486:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1487: 
 1488:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1489: 
 1490:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1491:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1492: 
 1493:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1494:     ?assertMatch(
 1495:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1496:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1497: 
 1498:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1499:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1500:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1501:                              }} =
 1502:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1503: 
 1504:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1505: 
 1506:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1507:         true ->
 1508:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1509:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1510: 
 1511:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1512:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1513:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1514:         false ->
 1515:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1516:             ok
 1517:     end,
 1518: 
 1519:     ok.
 1520: 
 1521: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1522: 
 1523:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1524:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1525:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1526:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1527: 
 1528:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1529:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1530:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1531: 
 1532:     ?assertMatch(
 1533:        {ok, Archive},
 1534:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1535: 
 1536:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1537:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1538:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1539: 
 1540:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1541:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1542: 
 1543:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1544:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1545: 
 1546:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1547:     ?assertMatch(
 1548:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1549:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1550: 
 1551:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1552:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1553: 
 1554:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1555:         true ->
 1556:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1557:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1558:         _ ->
 1559:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1560:             ok
 1561:     end,
 1562: 
 1563:     ok.
 1564: 
 1565: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1566: %%% Generic zip interface
 1567: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1568: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1569:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1570:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1571: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1572:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1573:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1574:     {ok, Archive};
 1575: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1576:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1577:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1578: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1579:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1580:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1581: 
 1582:     %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1583:     %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1584:     %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1585: 
 1586:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1587:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1588:           fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1589:                   AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1590:                   {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1591:                   CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1592:                   {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1593:                       if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1594:                               {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1595:                               lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1596:                                              [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1597:                          Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1598:                               {[],
 1599:                                 case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1600:                                     {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1601:                                     error ->
 1602:                                         {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1603:                                                 file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1604:                                                 Fi#file_info.size),
 1605:                                         Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1606:                                 end}
 1607:                       end,
 1608:                   {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1609:           end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1610:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1611: 
 1612: 
 1613: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1614: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1615:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1616:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1617:     {ok, Bin};
 1618: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1619:     E;
 1620: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1621:     E;
 1622: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1623:     file:close(D),
 1624:     [];
 1625: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1626:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1627:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1628: 
 1629: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1630:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1631: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1632:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1633:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1634:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1635:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1636:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1637:            lists:flatmap(
 1638:              fun(Ln) ->
 1639:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1640:                          nomatch -> [];
 1641:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1642:                      end
 1643:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1644: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1645:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1646:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1647:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1648: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1649:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1650:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1651:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1652:            [begin
 1653:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1654:                     $/ ->
 1655:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1656:                     _ ->
 1657:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1658:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1659:                 end,
 1660:                 F -- Cwd
 1661:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1662: 
 1663: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1664:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1665:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1666:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1667:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1668: 
 1669:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1670:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1671: 
 1672:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1673: 
 1674:     file:close(Src),
 1675:     file:close(Tgt).
 1676: 
 1677: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1678: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1679: 
 1680:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1681:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1682:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1683:         {E, E} ->
 1684:             ok
 1685:     end;
 1686: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1687:     ok.
 1688: 
 1689: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1690:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1691:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1692:     Res.
 1693: 
 1694: disc_free(Path) ->
 1695:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1696: 
 1697:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1698:     Partitions =
 1699:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1700:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1701: 
 1702:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1703:     %% path first.
 1704:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1705:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1706:         [] -> error
 1707:     end.
 1708: 
 1709: memsize() ->
 1710:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1711:         undefined ->
 1712:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1713:             Tot;
 1714:         Available ->
 1715:             Available
 1716:     end.
